summary: The diff adds a new /world route and page with a React Three Fiber 3D planet scene, plus a React Query hook that polls a registrant-count API and renders a numeric total. However, key parts of REQ-23 backend support are not evidenced in the backend diff, and the “new inhabitants appear” behavior (REQ-24) appears incorrectly implemented; performance safeguards for large counts are also not evidenced. Navigation includes a desktop header link to the new page; mobile inclusion cannot be confirmed from the truncated diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend query API to return total number of registrants with the same authentication policy as listAllRegistrants/searchRegistrants.
missing_requirements.reason: Frontend calls actor.getTotalNumberOfRegistrants(), but the backend diff snippet does not show any new query method being added/implemented, nor its auth checks. With truncated backend diff, there is insufficient evidence that the required backend API exists.

missing_requirements.requirement: When the registrant total increases between polls, add only the difference as new inhabitants and animate them appearing (without re-randomizing existing inhabitants).
missing_requirements.reason: WorldPage updates previousCount to the current count when count increases, which makes previousCount equal to count; PlanetWorldScene then marks new inhabitants using `isNew: i >= previousCount`, resulting in no inhabitants being treated as new on the updated render (and thus no entry animation on increases).

missing_requirements.requirement: Provide basic performance safeguards so the visualization remains usable for several hundred inhabitants (e.g., instancing/points/caps).
missing_requirements.reason: PlanetWorldScene renders one Mesh (sphereGeometry) per inhabitant via a map over `count` with no evident caps, instancing, or point rendering; this may not meet the performance safeguard requirement and no mitigation is shown in the diff.

hallucinated_features.description: Global “Canister ID Mismatch Detected” warning banner with a button to open a computed correct deployment URL.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asks for a new Digital World page, backend count API, polling, deterministic animated inhabitants, and navigation links. Deployment mismatch detection/remediation UI is not requested.
